wikipedia_page.main: Arthur James Lacey (20 May 1904 – 6 August 1979) was an English professional golfer who finished in the top ten of The Open Championship on four occasions in the 1930s. He also played in the 1933 and 1937 Ryder Cup matches, and was then selected as non-playing captain of the Great Britain and Ireland side for those matches in 1951. He was chairman of the PGA from 1949 to 1951.

In April 1951 the British P.G.A. appointed Arthur Lacey as non-playing captain and chose a selection committee of four which included Lacey and Bill Cox."The Ryder Cup". The Times, Thursday, April 19 1951; pg. 2; Issue 51979. In late-July eight players were selected: Bousfield, Daly, Faulkner, Hargreaves, Lees, Panton, Rees and Ward. The remaining two places were to be selected after the News of the World Match Play."The Ryder Cup Team". The Times, Wednesday, August 1 1951; pg. 2; Issue 52068. The final two places were later given to Weetman and Adams, the finalists in the News of the World Match Play. "Ryder Cup Team Completed". The Times, Monday, September 24 1951; pg. 7; Issue 52114.
